Their use of psychology throughout the intertwined narrative of both Ellie and Abby cannot be passed off as “lazy writing”. To make the player walk 5 miles in the shoes of the villain Abby after you as Ellie have wreaked revenge soaked havoc on her friends and faction for the death of Joel isn’t something I’ve experienced in gaming. It’s clever and effective. By the end of a 25-30 hour campaign\, you have 2 characters on opposing sides of the same coin in a story that deals with not just revenge but the morality of right and wrong and the effects of action and consequence.The motion capture is fantastic\, the Ellie and Joel flash back scenes are beautiful. New characters are charming but be warned\, this is not a story for the faint of heart. Emotions will be tested\, your heart will be pulled out whilst you get kicked in the guts.Gameplay-  not much new in terms of innovation but a more effective jump button allows for some new traversal options as well as squeezing through gaps to make those encounters a little more exciting.Prone position has been added which can give players a tactical edge.A plentiful arsenal. Both players have a well balanced array of weapons to master.Upgrades system has been simplified and crafting and scavenging remain a key component.Environments are very detailed and beautiful to look at. There’s the photo mode if you are so inclined.New game plus.Array of difficulty settings for those inclined to punish themselves.Accessibility options are huge for players\, I have seen visual and audio adaptation demos. I know that these settings are something that the disabled gamers have praised.I can see why this game has had some negative scores\, yes it’s a hard pill to swallow. Yes Joel is killed early on. Yes Abby’s character model can be distracting at first\, you need to suck it up and follow the story\, get into it\, listen and feel. It’s the only way the game will have meaning. Expectations will be subverted. I hated that phrase on Star Wars last Jedi\, which I’m still not happy with but it does work here.If part 3 is made I will give this a 9. I wasn’t 100 percent satisfied with the ending. I would have liked a little more on what the future held for Ellie.… Expand
